strapiArticle.title: Bistek Tagalog
strapiArticle.description: Made with thinly sliced beef steak.

childMarkdownRemark.html:
Ingredients:

  • 500 grams beef sirloin, thinly sliced
  • 4 tablespoons soy sauce
  • 2 tablespoons calamansi juice (or lemon juice)
  • 4 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 medium-sized onion, sliced into rings
  • 1/4 cup water
  • 2 tablespoons cooking oil
  • Salt and pepper, to taste
  • Optional: 1 tablespoon cornstarch, dissolved in 2 tablespoons water (for thickening the sauce)

Instructions:

  1. In a bowl, combine soy sauce, calamansi juice, and minced garlic. Mix well to create the marinade.

  2. Place the beef slices in the marinade, ensuring that each piece is well coated. Marinate for at least 30 minutes, or preferably overnight in the refrigerator, to allow the flavors to penetrate the meat.

  3. Heat cooking oil in a large pan or skillet over medium-high heat.

  4. Sear the marinated beef slices in the hot pan for about 1-2 minutes per side, or until they are browned. Cook in batches if needed. Remove the beef from the pan and set aside.

  5. In the same pan, add the sliced onions and saut√© until they become translucent and slightly caramelized.

  6. Return the seared beef slices to the pan, arranging them on top of the onions.

  7. Pour the remaining marinade over the beef and onions. Add water to the pan. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

  8. Cover the pan and let the Bistek simmer for about 10-15 minutes, or until the beef is tender and the flavors have melded together.

  9. Optional: If you prefer a thicker sauce, you can add the dissolved cornstarch to the pan and stir well. Cook for an additional minute until the sauce thickens.

  10. Remove from heat and transfer the Bistek Tagalog to a serving dish.

  11. Serve hot with steamed rice. You can also garnish it with additional onion rings on top for added flavor and presentation.

Bistek Tagalog is a delicious and savory dish that combines the richness of soy sauce and tanginess of calamansi or lemon juice. Enjoy this Filipino favorite!
